name: Mantra Aqueous On Port

reviews.text: We got a great deal through a Breakfree voucher - $500AU for a 7 night stay in a 2 bedroom apartment. The accommodation was definitely worth WAY more than this, in our opinion. The apartment was spotless and so well set up - the 2 bedroom apartments are actually a hotel room & a 1 bedroom apartment adjoined by a little foyer, so you can open up the internal doors and make it a 2 bedroom apartment, but with added bonuses like 2 bathrooms, 2 balconies and 2 spa baths - not to forget privacy when you want it. It was a great set up for us, which was a couple and a mother and daughter.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: The apartment had everything we needed when we wanted to cook meals, down to the things often missing from self-contained places, such as cheese graters and wooden spoons. It was modern and nicely decorated. It was in a perfect location, practically on the corner of Macrossan St and close to the beach. The 4 pools were always spotless, as were the bbq's. Make sure you have a warm spa on your balcony at night and then run down and jump in the pool! The toiletries in the bathrooms were nice touches. The only small oversight was that our apartment didn't get cleaned - it was supposed to be on day 4 - but it really wasn't a worry, or else we would have reminded them. Lisa at the desk was always helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: Great place to stay, love the jacuzzi

reviews.text: We'd definitely, definitely stay here again and hope to one day soon!
reviews.title: Great little hotel with friendly staff

reviews.text: We have just come back from a week long stay at the aqueous and we loved it. We stayed in an apartment room and everything was new and clean. It was great being so well equipped-dishwasher, washing machine, drier, all mod cons, but of course my favourite was the jacuzzi on the deck which we used every night.
reviews.title: Great Place!
Great accomodations
reviews.text: It was so close to town that we just had to stroll a minute or so onto Macrossan street where we could choose which restaurant to eat at that night. The staff were really helpful in planning our activities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 5 nights as we were attending a wedding in Port Douglas. This hotel is really nice although the corridors maybe looked a bit tired. The room however was very nice and we had a big room with kitchen and lounge as well as a private jacuzzi on the balcony - which all comes standard! The pool was great although pretty cold! Fab location as 5 mins from beach and even less to shops and restaurants. Would definitley stay here again. Worthwhile doing the Low Isles tour to the reef and the Mossman Gorge/Daintree River boat trips. Port Douglas is a great, laid back fun place with lots of choice for good restaurants.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Locked up early on at night

reviews.text: We had 4 nights at Aqueous on Port, 2 adults & 2 children aged 10 and 8 yrs. From our first meeting with the receptionist we were impressed by the attitude, appearance and standards.
reviews.title: Great place to be 40!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a top floor, 2 bed appartment which was fantastic, kids were blown away by having their own hot-tub on the balcony. Standard of finish and equipment was all excellent. The staff were always courteous and helpful, offering advice on everything from reef trips and restaurants to the local supermarket.
reviews.title: Great pools and location

likes.disliked: — room felt small and lack of storage in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only minor irritation was some noise from the road/construction site early in the morning. We had rooms at the rear of the property and the adjacent building was having some work done. Well it has to be done at some time and we were there in the winter.
reviews.title: A week in paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having said that, this did not spoil a wonderful stay and was a truly memorable place to help my wife "celebrate" becoming 40. We would not hesitate in returning.
reviews.title: Not a very relaxing holiday

likes.liked: — Close to beach and main street
likes.disliked: — The noisy construction site next door!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This block of apartments is just the way it looks on the website. If you are looking for an apartment in Port Douglas I can recommend the Mantra Aqueous.
reviews.title: Good accommodation and location

likes.disliked: — as it is a unit complex, very little service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its very close to restaurants, town etc, and an easy walk to the beach. Zinc restaurant is next door, as is the local bakery, which has good rolls, pies and sausage rolls.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartments run up the middle of the block of land, and on either side are 4 pools. This means you can always find either shade or sun, depending upon what you are after. The pools are quite deep, and on one side are the swim-up rooms, on the other a deck. Plenty of chairs etc.
reviews.title: Great Location at Aqueous!

likes.disliked: — No other services; bar, restaurant, etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would not take very small children to this resort, as there is no shallow end in any of the pools. This means you have to be in the water with them at all times - boring for parents who want a break I think.
reviews.title: Some good, some bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The two BBQ areas are kept clean and tidy, and have plenty of space. There are also tables and chairs in this area.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our honeymoon stay at the Mantra Aqueous in Port Douglas. We stayed in a hotel spa room with swim-up, which was quite adequate. If you want a room with ample space we would recommend you get an apartment room which looked very nice. The hotel room was very clean and adeqate with the queensize bed, ensuite and small kitchen (sink, cupboard, mini fridge, microwave and bowls, plates, cutlery and cups for two). The swim-up was excellent and even with a full occupancy, we didn't feel like our privacy was invaded while other people use the pool. However, our rom was right at the front of the hotel, hence people did not generally go that far down.
reviews.title: Honeymoon Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As stated by another review, we would not recommend this hotel for people with young kids as the pools range from 1.1m to 2.1m in depth.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay at Mantra Aqueous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent and this is somewhere we would return to in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel/location/service

likes.liked: — LOCATION, plenty of room in the pools for everyone, reasonably priced accom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our honeymoon with 7 nights at Mantra Aqueous on Port. We stayed in a 1 bedroom spa apartment, which was spacious and had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Loved the Spa on your Balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Airconditioning unit in the bedroom and living area, along with ceiling fans ensured we were very comfortable having come from a cooler climate. Having a private spa was also excellent.
reviews.title: Awesome

description: Offering a range of deluxe accommodation from hotel spa suites and spacious two bedroom apartments, all rooms feature air conditioning, pool views and a private balcony spa. Befitting the aquatic theme of the resort, Mantra Aqueous on Port offers four lagoon swimming pools and spas. There are also two cabanas with cook-your-own BBQ and outdoor dining facilities. Property facilities include: 4 outdoor pools and spas, Babysitting available, Sundecks and barbeque facilities, Tour desk, Undercover parking
